posts.post_content:
@Arachnos, [Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite) beats [Sheoldred, Whispering One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sheoldred, Whispering One) and [Vorniclex, Voice of Hunger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vorniclex, Voice of Hunger) in combat. Due to Norn's effect, Sheoldred becomes a 4/4 and Vorniclex becomes a 5/4 while Norn remains a 4/7 (Alive and **untapped**. She's one bad momma.   
  
Also, good luck playing Army of the Damned (with or without flashback) while this beauty is in standard.

Posted By: S-r-ex (4/14/2012 2:10:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Sweet card. Great design. Works great with [Heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Summoning) in Innistrad.  
  
I like the flavour text too. It hints that Phyrexia is not done in its conquest, and may try invading other worlds. [Argent Mutation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Argent Mutation) and [Remember The Fallen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Remember The Fallen) sort of point in the same direction. Will we see a Scars of Ravnica block soon? Or Esper Besieged? Time will tell.
posts.html:
Sweet card. Great design. Works great with Heartless Summoning in Innistrad.

I like the flavour text too. It hints that Phyrexia is not done in its conquest, and may try invading other worlds. Argent Mutation and Remember The Fallen sort of point in the same direction. Will we see a Scars of Ravnica block soon? Or Esper Besieged? Time will tell.

Does everybody see this?!? The Gitaxians know of other planes?!? The Phyrexians will return! There's going to be more infect in standard in the future!

posts.post_content: Elesh Norn is one of my favorite cards! I have a white Norn deck that locks everything down. She's another Lady Gaga card, but also reminds me of Clive Barker's Cenobites. Elesh Norn is easily the strongest Preator and shuts down many kinds of decks. The White Phyrexian's macabre twist to religious orthodoxy is dripping with flavor, I love the story and creative feel. Abandon your flesh.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
If you assume that her +/- ability affects her, you can see she's a Priest of herself (Norn) on steroids. And by that, I mean with a +1/+1 counter and without infect. That said, you can estimate her +/- ability costs about 4 mana. As an enchantment, that ability would be game breaking.

Posted By: j_mindfingerpainter (5/25/2012 4:20:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Flavorwise, I love all of the Praetors. They're all massive, as they should be, and their ability to boost their own while decimating their enemies fits perfectly into the Phyrexian paradigm.
  
   
Functionwise, WHY!? FOR THE LOVE OF GOD WHY WOULD YOU DO THIS WIZARDS!? -2/-2!?
  
   
Not only does that eliminate, like, half of any player's deck at least, but...why? That isn't white! That isn't white at all! Did you have nothing else you could do, guys? Nothing?
  
   
How about "Whenever a source you control deals damage, gain that much life.
  
Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage, they lose that much life."
posts.html:
Flavorwise, I love all of the Praetors. They're all massive, as they should be, and their ability to boost their own while decimating their enemies fits perfectly into the Phyrexian paradigm.

Functionwise, WHY!? FOR THE LOVE OF GOD WHY WOULD YOU DO THIS WIZARDS!? -2/-2!?

Not only does that eliminate, like, half of any player's deck at least, but...why? That isn't white! That isn't white at all! Did you have nothing else you could do, guys? Nothing?

How about "Whenever a source you control deals damage, gain that much life.
Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage, they lose that much life."
